text: Losses Are Piling Up. Tech Leads a Broad Selloff.The stock market’s declines accelerated in midday trading.The Dow was down 502 points, or 1.1%. The S&P 500 was down 1.5%. The Nasdaq Composite was down 2%.With virtually no news on the docket and trading thin for the holiday-shortened week, technology stocks were an especially large drag. The S&P’s tech sector was down 1.8%, followed by consumer discretionary with a decline of 1.6%. The communication services sector was down 1.2%.
html:
Losses Are Piling Up. Tech Leads a Broad Selloff.

The stock market’s declines accelerated in midday trading.

The Dow was down 502 points, or 1.1%. The S&P 500 was down 1.5%. The Nasdaq Composite was down 2%.

With virtually no news on the docket and trading thin for the holiday-shortened week, technology stocks were an especially large drag. The S&P’s tech sector was down 1.8%, followed by consumer discretionary with a decline of 1.6%. The communication services sector was down 1.2%.
